trans-unit.source: Get Started with authentication for Mobile Apps in Xamarin iOS
trans-unit.target: Get Started with authentication for Mobile Apps in Xamarin iOS

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Apps to authenticate users of your Xamarin iOS app through a variety of identity providers, including AAD, Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Apps to authenticate users of your Xamarin iOS app through a variety of identity providers, including AAD, Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Xamarin.iOS app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Xamarin.iOS app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users of an App Service Mobile App from your client application.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users of an App Service Mobile App from your client application.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by App Service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by App Service.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by your Mobile App, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by your Mobile App, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile App quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile App quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete the tutorial [Create a Xamarin.iOS app].
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete the tutorial [Create a Xamarin.iOS app].

trans-unit.source: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the authentication extension package to your project.
trans-unit.target: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the authentication extension package to your project.

trans-unit.source: For more information about server extension packages, see <link><linkText>Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about server extension packages, see <link><linkText>Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create an App Service Gateway
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create an App Service Gateway

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for authentication and configure App Services
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for authentication and configure App Services

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: 4.
trans-unit.target: 4.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, run the client project on a device or emulator.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, run the client project on a device or emulator.

trans-unit.source: Verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: Verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: The failure is logged to the console of the debugger.
trans-unit.target: The failure is logged to the console of the debugger.

trans-unit.source: So in Visual Studio, you should see the failure in the output window.
trans-unit.target: So in Visual Studio, you should see the failure in the output window.

trans-unit.source: This unauthorized failure happens because the app attempts to access your Mobile App backend as an unauthenticated user.
trans-unit.target: This unauthorized failure happens because the app attempts to access your Mobile App backend as an unauthenticated user.

trans-unit.source: The TodoItem table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: The TodoItem table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the client app to request resources from the Mobile App backend with an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the client app to request resources from the Mobile App backend with an authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will modify the app to display a login screen before displaying data.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will modify the app to display a login screen before displaying data.

trans-unit.source: When the app starts, it will not not connect to your App Service and will not display any data.
trans-unit.target: When the app starts, it will not not connect to your App Service and will not display any data.

trans-unit.source: After the first time that the user performs the refresh gesture, the login screen will appear; after successful login the list of todo items will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: After the first time that the user performs the refresh gesture, the login screen will appear; after successful login the list of todo items will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: In the client project, open the file QSTodoService.cs and add the following using statement and member declarations to QSTodoService:
trans-unit.target: In the client project, open the file QSTodoService.cs and add the following using statement and member declarations to QSTodoService:

trans-unit.source: Add a using statment for UIKit and add a new method named Authenticate to QSTodoService with the following definition:
trans-unit.target: Add a using statment for UIKit and add a new method named Authenticate to QSTodoService with the following definition:

trans-unit.source: If you are using an identity provider other than a Facebook, change the value passed to LoginAsync above to one of the following: MicrosoftAccount, Twitter, Google, or WindowsAzureActiveDirectory.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an identity provider other than a Facebook, change the value passed to LoginAsync above to one of the following: MicrosoftAccount, Twitter, Google, or WindowsAzureActiveDirectory.

trans-unit.source: Open QSTodoListViewController.cs.
trans-unit.target: Open QSTodoListViewController.cs.

trans-unit.source: Modify the method definition of ViewDidLoad to remove the call to RefreshAsync() near the end:
trans-unit.target: Modify the method definition of ViewDidLoad to remove the call to RefreshAsync() near the end:

trans-unit.source: Modify the method RefreshAsync to authenticate and display a login screen if the User property is null.
trans-unit.target: Modify the method RefreshAsync to authenticate and display a login screen if the User property is null.

trans-unit.source: At the following code at the top of the method definition:
trans-unit.target: At the following code at the top of the method definition:

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio connected to your Xamarin Build Host on your Mac, run the client project targeting a device or emulator.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio connected to your Xamarin Build Host on your Mac, run the client project targeting a device or emulator.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the app displays no data.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the app displays no data.

trans-unit.source: Perform the refresh gesture by pulling down the list of items, which will cause the login screen to appear.
trans-unit.target: Perform the refresh gesture by pulling down the list of items, which will cause the login screen to appear.

trans-unit.source: Once you have successfully entered valid credentials, the app will display the list of todo items, and you can make updates to the data.
trans-unit.target: Once you have successfully entered valid credentials, the app will display the list of todo items, and you can make updates to the data.
